Chat Summary: Water came up through the grass behind my house and poured into the lanai from the canal. Can flood panels help when the water is rising from multiple directions like that?
Underlying Need: Wants whole-yard flood plan, not single entry fix

Chat Summary: My garage door seal lifted last storm and water poured in from underneath. Are double-lip seals worth the upgrade?
The street drains overflowed and the water pushed up my driveway. Should flood panels be paired with a sump pit or will that trap water inside?
My installer didn’t caulk behind the track and now I see rust. Should I remove everything and redo the seal?
Heavy wind drives water through my lanai screen door. Are there panel systems designed for sideways rain, not just surge?
The dock hardware rusted fast after Ian. Will stainless bolts on flood panels hold up near the seawall?
I’m thinking about selling next year. Do flood barriers increase property value or make buyers nervous?
The storm drain down my block clogs every time. Should I raise my barrier height higher than the driveway level to compensate?
When power cuts out, my sump pump dies. Is there a manual pump option small enough for residential use?
I heard some insurers deny claims if panels aren’t engineered. Is there a specific certification I should look for in Lee County?
Water keeps sneaking in around my triple slider even after sealing. Would replacing the frame help or should I go with removable barriers?
My driveway slopes toward the house. Should I grind it flat where the barrier sits or build a concrete lip?
Our home was built in the 60s on a flat slab. Can flood panels attach to that kind of foundation safely?
I measured my own openings and ordered panels online. They don’t fit right. How do professionals measure differently?
My neighbor’s house smells bad after flooding. How can I keep my walls from trapping water if I use barriers?
Considering a permanent knee wall across the garage. Is that safer than removable flood barriers for this area?
I have dogs that go in and out through the garage door. Are there panel systems that can be opened quickly if I need to evacuate?
My HOA banned sandbags but hasn’t mentioned barriers. Do I need permission to mount brackets on my stucco?
I want protection but my budget is tight. Are used or refurbished flood panels safe to buy?
It feels like I spend half my life cleaning after every storm. Is there any permanent fix that won’t rot or rust here?
